title.narrative: Regional Community Colleges Empowerment on Modern Vegetable and Rice Production

description.narrative: A TMT can assist a lot in addressing the knowledge and skills shortcomings for improved vegetable production which will lead to better food security in the region. Also, the TMT is expected to improve the nutritional wellbeing in the community because with the new knowledge, other vegetables can be grown. The TMT can also gradually help our county modernise vegetable production through green house farming training.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 29777, 2502 LT The Hague, The Netherlands

description.narrative: Reporting is an important management tool which is used to inform relevant government officials and other stakeholders about the results being achieved by individual projects and the programme as a whole. For project partners, it is compulsory to use the prescribed Orange Knowledge annual report format in order to report on project achievements. The annual report also provides valuable data on the financial situation of the project. Based on an analysis of the project performance in relation to the project output(s) and expected outcome(s), a revision of the project work plan may be suggested by the project partners. The consequences of a possible revision on the project work plan and budget must be made clear in the annual report. Nuffic monitors outputs and outcomes and not activities . Therefore, the main focus of the annual report must be on the achievement of the project’s output(s) and planned outcome(s). The information provided in the annual reports of the projects is used by Nuffic to monitor the progress of the project and to inform the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and other stakeholders about the output(s) and outcome(s) being achieved by individual projects and the Orange Knowledge programme as a whole. Please note that if project progress is in accordance with the original planning, reporting requirements are minimal. Only in case of deviations from the planning, more elaboration is demanded. In the grant award letter, the dates for submission of the annual reports are mentioned. In case of a three-year project, between 5-7 reports are obligatory. The first report (0) is a very short report which focuses on specific conditions and/or recommendations in the grant. There is no need to report on progress in achieving outputs and outcomes, which is done in the first annual report. As annex to the report 0, the consortium agreements between the partners should be submitted. The final report must reflect on the entire project period.

Final conclusions TMT+/TMT (in case of final report) Reflect on how the training has contributed to addressing the capacity needs as described by the requesting organisation in the proposal form. How effective and efficient has the TMT+ been in reaching the desired objectives? Please formulate lessons learned and recommendations for the post-project period.
+
In your email submitting the final report, the partners will enclose: - an inventory of equipment purchased - a document signed by the (Lead partner) Dutch consortium/provider and Lead partner consortium country A or requesting organisation on the transfer of ownership - a list with the names and email addresses of staff members who participated in staff training for their registration in the Holland Alumni Network database

actual.value:
Covid-19 restrictions made us to resort to online training for us to be able to offer the training in a timely manner. But on the positive side, online training experience also proved to a good learning experience for both trainers and trainees because it went on smoothly and the trainers and trainees were able to interact effectively through tailor made videos, online interactions and in instances of poor internet network, WhatsApp came in handy.
Blending online trainings with a 2 week practical training on-site in Liberial also provided the trainees with a good opportunity to see and participate in the practical implementation of the training content.

description.narrative: In this section (maximum 1000 words), please provide a global overview of the project progress **per output**. To what extent have they been achieved? Comment on the activities that have taken place and the most important milestones.

actual.value:
Delphy and Ecofarm were supposed to provide 5 training weeks at location and the group of trainees were supposed to have an exchange visit to Kenya. Unfortunately due to the Covid-19 restriction, the training program has changed. The implemented activities are:
- before the start of the training, we have made an in depth needs assessment at the Colleges. Based on the results, we have prepared the training materials. - The training program was supposed to be 5 field trainings. This has been changed into 4-week online trainings and 2x 10 days training in Liberia. The trained topics are: - 2 Online trainings on greenhouse and open field training of tomatoes and peppers (subjects: plant physiology, vegetable nursery management, seeds and planting material management, weed management, GAP, crop nutrients and fertilizer management, IPM) - Online training on entrepreneurship (business development, marketing strategies, financial record keeping and business planning) - 10 day Field training on greenhouse and open field training at Ecofarms (5 days) and set up of the demonstration fields for the Colleges - Rice production trainings - implementation of a practical greenhouse training at the greenhouses of Ecofarms in Liberia (as replacement of the greenhouse training in Kenya) by Delphy trainers. In this training all trainees were involved. - During the trainings, the participants discuss and made a fertilizer and pesticides application programs which need to result in increase of yields in rice production - set up of open field, rice and vegetable demonstration sites at the Colleges coordinated by Delphy trainers. These sites will act as a common learning site for the 3 colleges involved.

title.narrative: B. Enhanced knowledge and skills of individuals and organisations (in partner countries and in the NL) in line with country/regional specific labour market needs & aiming at inclusiveness
B.O.1. Number of organisations strengthened by individual and/or group training

comment.narrative: 14-07-2021: 3 community college were involved (teachers and students).

title.narrative: B.I.1. Number of scholarship holders / TMT participants that have successfully completed course/training (male / female / minorities)

comment.narrative: 15-07-2021: Thanks for the efforts. Could you please let us know why this number (13) is different from the one used (19) to compute the value 100% for the indicator B.I.2?

title.narrative: B.I.2. % scholarship holder's /TMT participants / alumni satisfaction
B.O.2. % of alumni / TMT participants who have applied the acquired knowledge and skills within their working environment
B.I.8. % alumni / TMT participants who state that they have acquired new knowledge and skills; e.g. problem solving, effective communication
B.I.4. % of scholarships awarded to women
B.I.10. Changes in personal, academic and professional attitudes and attributes through training and education programmes

actual.value: Generally the opinion of the trainees from the evaluation is that the training was good because it improved their knowledge on doing simple but important tasks such as nursery management and compost making. Most of the trainees also appreciated the knowledge shared on greenhouse/net house farming which was conducted with reference with the local climate. The new experience of online trainings was also well received by the trainees.

title.narrative: B.I.11. Improved gender equality and gender awareness in the workplace

actual.value:
Women are well represented among the lectureres in the agriculture departments of the 3 colleges. In the selection process of the participants, we have been very keen on the representation of almost 50% female participants. This was also our requirement before training. The list of participants have been reviewed 1 month before the training starts. All colleges has selected close to 50% female participants.
​
In the training program we have incorporated gender related issues. E.g. when it came up to use of pesticides and fertilizers, we have discussed topic such as crop protection versus femal fertility. During the entrepreneurship training we discussed the decision making on farmer income, equality of genders etc.
